english: thousands die to make one hero; one general reaches glory, ten thousand bones are left to dry

japanese: 案ずるより産むが易し
english: it is easier to do something than worry about it; fear overruns the danger; it is easier to bear (a child) than to worry about it

japanese: 武士は食わねど高楊枝
english: the samurai glories in honourable poverty; keep a stiff upper lip!
a law is a law, however undesirable it may be
children are a reflection of their parents

japanese: 秋茄子は嫁に食わすな
english: don't feed autumn eggplant to your wife (because they're too delicious, because they'll give her the chills, or because their lack of seeds will reduce her fertility)
children do not know how dear they are to their parents (and therefore act selfishly)
history repeats itself

japanese: 嘘つきは泥棒の始まり
english: show me a liar, and I will show you a thief

japanese: 燕雀安んぞ鴻鵠の志を知らんや
english: only a hero can understand a hero; swallows and sparrows can't understand the aspirations of phoenixes and swans
you can't catch the wind with a net
if the kids make a racket outside, there will be rain

japanese: 己に如かざる者を友とするなかれ
english: do not befriend those beneath you
even monkeys fall from trees; anyone can make a mistake; pride comes before a fall; even Homer sometimes nods
a wise man keeps some of his talents in reserve; one shouldn't show off; the person who knows most often says least; a skilled hawk hides its talons
the flame that burns twice as bright burns half as long; the well with sweet water will be the first to run dry
slow but steady wins the race; constant effort will result in success; constant dripping wears away a stone

japanese: 見ると聞くとは大違い
english: there is a great difference between being told about something and actually seeing it with your own eyes
flies are attracted to foul smells; ruffians flock together
all men are alike; all lives are alike; all men live and die; we all bleed the same; a pike conger has one life, a shrimp does too
a good workman does not blame his tools

japanese: 朝に道を聞かば、夕べに死すとも可なり
english: if a man hears the Way in the morning, he may die in the evening without regret
you're never too old to learn

japanese: 借りる時の地蔵顔、済す時の閻魔顔
english: people look friendly when they ask for a loan but not so much when they repay it; when borrowing (the money), the face of the (bodhisattva) Kshitigarbha; when returning it, the face of the (hell king) Yama

japanese: 下手の考え休むに似たり
english: it's hard to tell a poor thinker from a sleeping one; they to whom only bad ideas come might as well be asleep; inadequate ideas are worse than none at all
natural state; being unspoilt by human touch; willows are green, flowers are crimson
things depend on how you use them; all things have their uses when they are used in the right way
